titleStmt.title: E. D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 528
CWG11500

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 45th, 47th, 48th, and 49th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Muster Rolls

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, November 28th, 1863.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 528.
(Extract.)

22. At the request of the Governor of Kentucky, Hospital Steward William B. Swisher, 2d Ohio Cavalry, will be discharged the service of the United States, upon the receipt of this order, at the place where he may be serving, to enable him to accept promotion.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
Saml Breck
Assistant Adjutant General.

49: Infy
Ass. Surg. Swisher
Discharged as Hospital Steward
Filed Decr 5. 1863
